name: Moonstruck on Pringle Bay Guesthouse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It sounds too good to be true but Moonstruck really is 'faultless'. We travel extensively and for a B&B Moonstruck can put many a 5 star hotel to shame. We spent three nights there in Pan room which was beautiful. It has magnificent views from the private balcony, a lovely sitting area, super four poster bed, a decanter of sherry and a bathroom with Neroli amenities and a good variety of towels. Breakfasts are excellent with an extremely good choice of hot and cold dishes. Moonstruck is in very easy walking of the village with its shops and restaurants. Do take a torch with you at night as there are no street lights. Karen and her staff make this a very memorable place to stay and yes, we would return tomorrow!
reviews.title: Fautless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we visit South Africa,we like to stay at a combination of new places and old favourites...we always plan our trip around Moonstruck! The rooms are lovely and so comfortable.The infinity pool is always so clean and inviting with great sun loungers to relax on and enjoy the spectacular view.Breakfasts are freshly prepared and yummy.The area around Pringle Bay is beautiful and peaceful. Lots of restaurants in the area ,we love Hook Line and Sinker which is within easy walking distance. Karen is a great host and we always look forward to returning.
reviews.title: We love Moonstruck on Pringle Bay!

reviews.text: Having spent a long day visiting the numerous vineyards along the way from Cape Town and enjoying the incredible scenery on one side and looking out for whales (which we saw) on the other, we arrived quite tired at Moonstruck in the early evening.
reviews.title: The Perfect Guest House with the Perfect Host

reviews.text: We were warmly welcomed by Karen (pronounced Karin) who showed us to our room - the quality and ambience of the whole guest house hits you immediately. It is simply stunning and Karen has done an exceptional job of decorating the whole house
reviews.title: Aesthetic beauty in a majestic setting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Karen joined us when we had refreshed ourselves to help us plan our days ahead and get the very best out of our visit to the area. Her knowledge is astonishing and we were so glad to have had the benefit of it as we changed a number of the things planned, as a result we had 2 fantastic days in the area, Penguins Otters, Beaches, the Hangclip and the legendary Plankies Bar, as well as 2 exceptional meals in restaurants Karen recommended and arranged for us
reviews.title: Magnificent

description: Moonstruck on Pringle Bay, a contemporary beach house retreat, offers private and luxurious oceanfront accommodation with panoramic views. The guesthouse is an "idyllic romantic getaway" for enjoying a coastal vacation. The pristine sandy beach is under a 3 minutes stroll through an indigenous "fynbos" greenbelt in front of the house; ensuring our accommodation is perfectly located for a beach vacation. Operating on a bed and breakfast (B&B) basis, guests enjoy breakfasts whilst enjoying mountain and ocean views, with an array of quality restaurants all within easy strolling distance of Moonstruck.
